title: Hextech Crafting
body:
As someone who recently posted about how bad hextech crafting has become this season (in earlier days you got more 'free' skins because the shards disenchanted for a reasonable amount of OE), I bought RP today for the first time in about a year.

Thought I'd try these new 'masterwork' chests.

Bought one, opened it and got Pulsefire Ezreal. The skin permanent and not the shard.
I didn't even know this happens? It's not listed as one of the possible contents of the chest?!?!?

replies.body:
Lol Seras, you know I don't have 'mains', I only ARAM (hit 4k wins the other day).

But your point on skin shards seems valid. I might adopt that method.

And the next 6 I opened gave me 5 skin shards (2 epic, 1 legacy, 2 normal), 1 ward skin shard (instant disenchant into OE) and an emote.

I'll have to disenchant 4 of those skin shards, just to unlock the 5th (an epic one).

OE from disenchanting skin shards needs to increase, it's so terrible atm, and anytime I've tried rolling 3 shards into a random skin permanent, it's always been lowest value old shit that no one would ever buy.

So do I get the 1 epic I'd like, or keeps both epic shards and get a random skin?

Way I do it (with free ones mind) is keep any skins that are 750 value or under to reroll, and disenchant 975 and above that I don't want to redeem. At this point I have all the skins I'd want for my mains, so anything extra is just kind of a bonus, and the OE value of those reroll skins is so low it's better value to reroll even for a random skin for me.

I understand making the values low for free stuff, but it makes buying chests feel not so great. Perhaps if they put some extra OE in Masterwork chests or something like that I dunno.
